It is client specific code to introduce a check to ensure that when the MDV event is seen to be ready, it truly does not have any un-validated unfinished MDV events linked to the fund. When there are un-validated unfinished MDV events, then STP process allows rules that fail but have an error level of warning to skip the check and allow the validation to continue. The 'Generic Decomposition - Upload Results' batch job produces fund decomposition data for the Investment Analytics Platform. The solution was flawed in the scenario where a component moves out of the fund, e.g. in case of a sell transaction. In this case, the market value SOD and cash flow SOD values that corresponds to the "moves out" would appear on the residual instead of on the component itself.

The problem has been solved by enhancing the 'Generic Decomposition - Upload Results' batch job, so it produces a data record for the component on the day it moves out. The record has SOD and EOD weights equal to zero to dictate that the component moves out. With this additional data record, the market value SOD and cash flow SOD values appear on the component itself, thus resulting in a better decomposition.

Please note that existing data in the Investment Analytics Platform will not be impacted by this correction. A new 'Generic Decomposition - Upload Results' is needed for this correction to impact the results in the Investment Analytics Platform.

The portfolio calculation did not include a bank account position having a zero balance on the first calculation date, but a non-zero balance on the last calculation date. The problem was that a cost/tax payment in the bank account had a cost payment date prior to its transaction agreement date; while the last portfolio calculation date was later than the cost payment date, but prior to the transaction agreement date. The zero-position check in the portfolio calculation did not find such payments. The error has been corrected for both bank accounts and cash buckets.

Special ex/cum functionality can be disabled from a specific end-date in Transaction Options.
When disabled, but Dividends was created before the end-date, the dividend payment date was used instead of the ex date for calculating the nominal basis.
This was not correct as before it was disabled it was the ex date that was used for calculating the nominal basis.

The problem has been solved by using the ex date also when the functionality is disabled, but dividends are generated before the end-date.

It is not possible to turn on extra logging only for FOD services (logging of processing queue) without turning on logging  from all stations (logging of enqueueing). This is very inconvenient in production environment on client side, because we are not sure all stations have access to log folder.
Fixed. Now it is possible to log only FOD servers. In worst case (in case there is no access to log folder for some reason), only FOD services will fail which is much less dangerous.
